channel.title: Troubleshooting on Hurst Systems
channel.description: Recent content in Troubleshooting on Hurst Systems

item.title: TroubleShooting a Users HomeDrive Auto-Remapping
item.description: We had a select few new users that would have their ‘HomeDrive’ set to N:\ in Active Directory, but the drive letter would be Z:\ when they logged into their machine. We would remap it within windows back to N:\ but upon logging out and back in again, the drive letter would change back to Z: I scoured the (local and global) GPO’s to make absolutely sure that nothing was remapping the HomeDrive.
